Introduced MacroData interface as a layer between macroexpansion and spf1data
Macro [r] (receiving domain) was not supported
Splitted parser in parser + resulting record. Refactored parser to dynamically load mechanisms.
Moved regexp to modifiers class.
Cleaning refactoring: Mechanism "building" logic moved to SPF1Parser. Now the Mechanisms need only to declare their REGEX as static "known" fields.
Refactored, again, the parser creation scheme. Now the parser know very little of the mechanism/modifier internals and dynamically build the regexp starting from modifier/mechanism collections.
Removed IPUtil class: now that MXMechanism extends AMechanism they can share that method.

- Removed "Exception" in favor of PermError in MacroExpand - Removed unused fields from SPF and SPF1Data - Big parser refactoring (still in progress) - default Explanation moved to ExpModifier - Removed unused method from IPAddr
Minor cleanup
Removed a lot of static final public regexp. Now that the parser doesn't need to know the name-value separation we don't need all that declaration!
-fix a bug which caused SPF class return every time pass. That was cause cause the result was not set to the new one if a mechanism or modifier match

-TempErrorException get now thrown if the lookup result is not HOST_NOT_FOUND or SUCCESSFULLY -Change the method getARecords to use lookup method of dnsjava so we can check for the query result -change a few classes to throw the TempErrorException
Just a few more docs etc..
Updated SPFTest for new TempErrorException, Updated SPF to use a single parser for multiple checks Updated Directive to throw error with no mechanism Improved exception for IP4 not matching
Parser refactoring (in-progress). Now we use only 1 dynamically generated, dynamically looked-up, regex for the whole parsing!
Refactoring: moved MatchResultSubset to the util package, added comments.
Improved test-suite speed by reusing the SPF1Parser and SPF objects between tests
-Add getAAAARecords method -Modify AMechanism to use getARecords for ipv4 connections and getAAAARecords for ipv6 connections

-Add authors -Fix a bug on mechanism processing. Now the ehile loop get break if a match was returned from the mechanism. -Set the qualifier to "+" pass if its empty -Set default result to "?" neutral like discripted in RFC

Added ip6 parsing stuff from Harmony project and changed IPAddr to use that code. Now we pass IP6 parsing tests.
Updated test_parser to pass all the tests. Many tests were not spec compliant.
SPF1Test refactored to run tests in order and moved the MockDSNService to a different class. Now only 29 SPF tests fail, while we pass all parser tests

Implemented the IncludeMechanism. We now pass 2 more tests. Maybe it is yet incomple/inaccurate.

Moved "match" and current result to spfData Implemented the RedirectModifier Reviewed some failing test and commented in test.txt the wrong tests. We only have 7 failing tests!!

Introduced a DNSService.setRecordLimit to change the default record lookup limit of 10. Added few tests and removed unused code to increase coverage from 68 to 71%. Converted old tests to the new YAML format (JSPF-26).
Remove unused tests after the conversion to YAML of the previous ones (JSPF-26).
Moved common YAML test code to AbstractYamlTest.
First step towards a secure (managed) maven2 build (JSPF-27). This one does not include ibiblio libraries in the final package.

Changed "error" to "permerror": this seems what is used as the official reply for a permanent error.
Add missing svn:eol-style=native property to yaml tests and NeutralException

Refactored DNSServiceXBillImpl to remove duplicate code (introduced a generic getRecords including common code)
Allow the user to set a default explanation on cmdline usage. See JSPF-28
Removed NoneException from DNSService: we now return null when no record is found (JSPF-29) Temporarily changed the first rfc4408 test to add 10 chars to the tested label (To be verified)
Moved record limit check from ExistsMechanism to DNSServiceImpl.
Changed DNSService.getRecord to get an internal int as a type and to always return a list of strings for the lookup (JSPF-29)
Simplifications for the previous DNSService refactoring (JSPF-29)
Further simplifications for the previous DNSService refactoring: removed internal getTXTRecords (JSPF-29)

A lot of changes for JSPF-29 : Fixed mailzone-tests.yml and tests.yml to use "inverse-ip.in-addr.arpa" instead of "ip" for PTR records Updated rfc4408 test to the last available online: changed the first test to have 64 chars in the label instead of 54. Added a toString() to all the mechanism/modifiers so that they give useful informations when printed out. Introduced a DNSService.TimeoutException to be used instead of the TempErrorException in dns calls (added catch and rethrow TempError in the caller) Removed the record specific calls from the DNSService interface in favor of the generic getRecord. Moved the SPF specific logic from DNSService to the caller terms/code.

Fix for 2 failing tests: 1) SPF open group changed his mind about the MX limit 2) The trim we did on the returned SPF was trimming a null in the spf record and we were not failing: now we don't trim it and correctly fail to parse it!
Add support for best guess. See JSPF-24
Fix Nullpointer which get thrown if no Record was found.

lookup AAAA-Record in PTR if the connecting ip is ip6 move some code

Correct handling of ipv4-mapped-addresses. All junit test pass now

Updated pom to use people.apache.org instead of minotaur.
Add support for trusted-forwarder.org. See JSPF-30
Add support of trusted-forwarder.org to SPFQuery. See JSPF-30

Updated rfc4408.yml tests from new.openspf.org (we still pass them) Introduced an SPFChecker interface to be used for recursive call as a dependency. Made it possible for SPF to receive an external SPFParser (so we can reuse it) Optimized tests to reuse a single SPFParser between tests (it is stateless) Fixed SPF to avoid settingup the FallbackPolicy if not enabled. Removed few catch(Exception e) in favor of specific exception catches Changed ipAddr method to avoid throwing NumberFormatException and wrap it in a PermErrorException. Changed include/redirect to not create a new SPF object but to use the spfProbe (SPFChecker) service embedded in spf1data.

Introduced a Configuration parameter interface for Configurable. Introduced an SPFRecordParser interface for the parser Refactored the parser to smaller components (introduced the TermsFactory, and its default implementation). Some class has been moved around to have a better package dependency structure. Now: overall coverage 75%, parser coverage 95%.
Remove not needed synchronized

Moved enabling interfaces to the "wiring" package. Removed services from SPF1Data. Introduced a WiringService (in the wiring package). A component (Factory) creating childs to be serviced can use WiringService.wire(Object). Packages changes, names changes and few more refactoring have to be done.

Complete refactoring of SPF class: introduced the concept of Policy and NestedPolicy. Now the SPF processing is based on a set (chain) of Policies. Basic behaviours have been added to the "policies" package and optional behaviours have been added to "policies.local" package. SPF1Record now contains an iterator method that return a chained iterator over the terms. SPF1Record now is able represents both a parsed record (previous record) or an unparsed spf record (String).
Forgot to remove the localpolicy empty package

Removed SPFInternalResult (we don't use it anymore) Moved DefaultExplanationPolicy to policies.local Introduced a common abstract SPFResultException to be used as the root of our exceptions: the concrete implementations provide also the string representation of the result to use.
Removed unused methods constants to reach 76.5% coverage (ok this is cheating ;-) ) Moved service implementations with dependencies in the impl package (we could even move this to a different module)
Remove the initalizeFallback method and use lazy initalization
Add support for Override. See JSPF-36 and JSPF-32

Updated openspf yaml tests to current trunk and fixed a couple of bugs in JSpf testsuite: 1) mocked dns server was case sensitive in search => changed to use lowercase hosts 2) mocked dns server did not support CNAMEs
Update rfc4408 tests to be update date.
Add new Version of rfc4408 test file. The tests now the same as the official released testsuite on new.openspf.org Fix a bug in junit tests

Added support for childloggers to ConsoleLogger (and write the logger name to output) Make use of ChildLoggers also in tests. Added a main to org.apache.james.jspf.RFC4408YamlTest that use log4j (to help spf spec people testing our tests)
Some code cleanup.
Update to new testsuite. Fix a bug with more then one explanation TXT-Record
Fix macro expansion: now it should be more strict and compliant.
Second fix for macro expansion: now it should be strict and compliant.
Upgrade to dnsjava 2.0.3 final: support for SPF type  (JSPF-39, JSPF-10)
Removed rfc4408-tests YAML file because of to be verified (questionable) licensing issues (CC-BY-SA). Updated the testsuite to provide a link to the downloadable testsuite.
Get ready for next beta release
Add section to reflect new jspf release

Fix so that exp=something and redirect=something are not valid UnknownModifiers (rfc interpretation) Fixed pom to not use the apache m1 repository and added commons-cli and junit.jar into the local repository.
Svn ingored maven/eclipse trash
Small change to ExpModifier to support "exp=" as non permerror as required by the currently discussed Errata for RFC4408.
Fix bug in ipv6 lookup by AMechanism (ClassCastException)
Remove duplicated expansion of host (waste of resources and possible bugs/security issues)
First step of refactoring to make MacroExpand a service (thread-safety)
Remove unneccessary cast/instance of

Removed dns dependency from SPF1Data: now MacroExpand has dns dependency and take care of managing this. Introduced MacroExpandEnabled to declare dependency on MacroExpand services and moved it to a singleton service (performance improvement)
Removed method from the AbstractNestedPolicy: the postfilter already has the capabilities of the fallback filter, so no need to use both.
Refactored the Policy support from Nested (Policy/NestedPolicy/AbstractNestedPolicy) to Policy+PolicyPostFilter and linear iterative pattern (simpler to be approached via events).
Upgrade log4j to version 1.2.14 Upgrade jvyaml to version 0.2.1
Removed unused method from SPF1Record.
Minor fix in ParseRecordPolicy: if record is already parsed, do not parse it.
Update news formatting and some link (openspf website, download pages to point to mirrors)
Renaming repos/third-party-m1 to stage to better follow the new server-modular structure.
Renaming repos/third-party-m1 to stage to better follow the new server-modular structure.
Renaming repos/third-party-m1 to stage to better follow the new server-modular structure.
Renaming repos/third-party-m1 to stage to better follow the new server-modular structure. Added some comment to pom.xml for m2 build workarounds.
new trunk created from the asynch-jspf branch.

Changed the package goal to create: 1) the main jar 2) the javadoc jar 3) the sources jar 4) the src package including the full tree 5) the bin package including the main jar, the runtime dependencies jars, the javadocs. Updated staged dependencies. Make use of the remote resources plugin to bundle a LICENSE/NOTICE in generated artifacts.
remote eclipse specific settings
Add "official" jars/pom/xml (did this in the branch before by mistake)
Remove build.xml to replace it
Add workin build.xml
Updated dnsjnio dependency. Updated pom to depend on non-snapshot when possible (and to point to updated stage folder)
IllegalStateException(Exception e) is not available in java 1.4
Add build instructions for linux
Only some small javadocs corrections

Updated AbstractYamlTest (thought this was already committed, but I see many differences...weird). Updated dnsjava to in house built version of current trunk (including spf record patch submitted to dnsjava) Updated dnsjnio to 0.9.7 official source code, but locally rebuilt because official 0.9.7 is java6 (class version 50). We fail multispf1 and multispf2 tests from official testsuite (only in real environment), but there is an ongoing errata about this on spf-devel.
Updated dnsjava to 2.0.5 (JSPF-51) This is finally java 1.4 compatible and correctly supports SPF records comparison/serialization.
Minor change to SPFRetriever: added a constant to switch from SPF+TXT resolution to TXT only (rarely useful when testing fallback behaviour)
Update dnsjnio to the new ASLv2 licensed/java 1.4 compatible 0.9.8 release (JSPF-41)
Remove redundant code from test class.

Created a fake dnsserver launcher class. This class allow running a fake dnsserver on the given interface/port reading the given yaml file and the given test suite description. If the parameters are correct the server will start listening/answering until killed.
Fix some javadocs Code cleanup Add license headers
Big class-shake to try removing a cyclic dependencies hell, Part 1 (JSPF-54)

Big class-shake to try removing a cyclic dependencies hell, Part 2 (JSPF-54) Every cycle has been removed. I'm not very satisfied with the resulting structure, but having no cycle will help the next steps.
Fix some visibilities... Fix some typos Add visibility modifier's to be more "inline" with other coding style in this project
Add some more javadocs Rename the DefaultSPF1Parser to RFC4408SPF1Parser and declare it final (because its a "RFC" implementation) Fix a synchronize issue..
Remove the final declaration ( this was bad idea at all )
Promoted public nested exception classes to top level classes.
Remove unused test class (including no tests)
Move MacroData to core package (same afferent/efferent dependencies). A single class in a package means too much fragmentation.
Move MacroData to core package (same afferent/efferent dependencies). A single class in a package means too much fragmentation.
Move utils to core package (same afferent/efferent dependencies). 2 classes in a package was too much fragmentation (all of the code depending on utils also depends on core).
Remove empty packages ( Stefano seems to miss this..)
Correct visibility....
Update README to show the usage of DefaultSPF class
Remove empty package
Correct visibility.... ( missed this before)

Moved SPF to the impl package (single class package does not make sense. Most people will anyway use DefaultSPF from the impl package). Moved "Enabling interfaces" from _wiring_ to the same package of the service interface.
More packages reorganization.
Move TimeoutException to the exceptions package
Renamed Configurable to ConfigurationEnabled to follow the "Enabled" naming we already use for every other service.
Move Configuration/ConfigurationEnabled to the terms package (only user of the 2 interfaces)
Remove empty packages
move TermDefinition/TermsFactory implementations to impl.
Added some basic code documentation to README (is this the best place?).
Fix for a newly introduced NPE. I made this inner class "static" and forgot to assign the logger.
Move port configuration for the FAKE_SERVER tests to a constant.
remove unused test resource
Added poms for our dependencies. Upgraded commons-cli to 1.1
Add missing license headers
Added ASLv2 header to dnsjava/jnamed based classes.

Remove NOTICE.txt and LICENSE.txt from our sources: the one included in generated packages are automatically generated by maven and build using pom.xml+src\main\appended-resources\supplemental-models.xml  files). Having this files in the root gives the wrong feeling that changing them give some result in the output packages, so it's better to remove them.
Fixed plugins dependencies (build reproducibility) and upgrade some of them to the latest available. Added some more sentence to the NOTICE generator (copied from the previous NOTICE.txt file)
Small fixes to BUILDING.txt
new.openspf.org => www.openspf.org in rfclist.
Remove JavaDocs warning.
Add serial version uids to Exceptions.
Using commons-cli formatter for usage. Improved parameter documentation and added short options.
Add libspf2.LICENSES file (license for test_*.txt resources). Added reference to the NOTICE generator (pom). Added ASF header to the mailzone-tests.yml.

Readd rfc4408-tests.yml and added copyright and PSFL license references to the pom (NOTICE generator). Just preparing things: we should be allowed to redistribute PSFL files, but this is still under investigation.
Tweaked command line parameter names for better intelligibility and compliance with other spf tools.
update parent project to the 1.2 "staged" release.
minor update to pom comment

another minor issue in the comments

Updating headers for jnamed derived files following Robert suggestion.

Renamed libspf2.LICENSES to libspf2.LICENSE (naming convention for license files). Added automatic RAT check to the maven build / site generation. Excluded from RAT checks the resources already taken into consideration in NOTICE. Changed the NOTICE text to be more specific about included 3rd party files and inspiration sources.
update index.xml to reflect new jspf release
Fix spelling and version number
Added some more explanation about the parent-pom issue to the BUILDING.txt. Thanx to Bernd for pointing out that the comment in the pom.xml was not so visible.

Updated rfc4408-tests.yml to openspf BSD licensed one (JSPF-58). The rfc4408-tests.* have been downloaded from http://www.openspf.org/source/project/test-suite/. The LICENSE file says it's BSD, The copyright for the files is: (C) 2006-2007 Stuart D Gathman <stuart@bmsi.com>
"exp=" have to result in PermError. Update the exp parsing string and our mailzone-tests.yml to reflect this change in the specification (JSPF-56).
Make sure to clean up caches when the "faked zone" changes (JSPF-59)

Update dnsjnio to 0.9.9. Fixes an NPE on answers received after the internal timeout (JSPF-57). The pom file has been created by me, the jar file has been downloaded from sourceforge and extracted from the the dnsjnio-0.9.9.tar.gz. The package is distributed under the Apache Software License v2.0.
Update the rfc4408-tests.yml to the latest available from the openspf group.
Throw IllegalArgumentException on invalid data given for SPFSession. See JSPF-60
fix bad format
Next try to fix JSPF-60
Finally fix JSPF-60 ( all tests pass again )
Fix format ( eclipse drives me crazy )
Inlined SPFSession.setupData private method content to the constructor calling it. This make more evident that there is no need to catch NoneException.

Make sure we correctly use "postmaster" as localpart when we receive no local part. Remove workaround from the testsuite. Make sure we don't check the whole record when the input IP is malformed but direclty return the permerror (JSPF-60).
Minor fix in probably unused code. (we returned the short error instead of the long one)
We don't need this file not found lazy "check" anymore. We can bundle the testsuite file now.

Made a refactoring so that there is no more an ExceptionCatcher stack in SPFSession. Now every SPFChecker can implement ExceptionCatcher so that a single checker stack is needed/used and it seem a little clearer and the logic to remove "skipped" checkers can be moved to the executors (much better).
Remove "System.out"s.
Minor fixes and updated README.txt to reflect the catchers removal.
Exclude release.properties from rat checks

Update dependency to dnsjnio-1.0.0-beta-2. This is a beta release from the dnsjnio project distributed under the ALv2 license. Alex fixed the random port issue, and the QID issue related to DNS vulnerabilities.
Remove obsolete content.
Create a src.zip/tar.gz package including the whole source tree (JSPF-68) Remove src/source packages from the resolver module (we don't need them for resolver)
Updated dnsjnio to 1.0.0 final (JSPF-64/JSPF-65). The jar comes from the zip distributed by sourceforge. The pom has been created by me.
javadoc 2.5 requires maven 2.0.9 (hudson has an older version)
update rfc4408-tests.yml to revision 107 (04 Dec 2008) http://www.openspf.org/source/project/test-suite/rfc4408-tests.yml?revision=107&view=markup
Correctly handle dollar sign in local-part of emailaddress. See JSPF-71. Thx to Frank Stolle for reporting
Add assertEquals (JSPF-71)
Upgrade to dnsjnio 1.0.2 (JSPF-73)
Also add escaping for backslash in regex replace strings (JSPF-71) From javadocs, both dollar and backslash need escaping. (also replaced tabs with spaces for our formatting convention).
Upgraded parent project to 1.3 final.

Added "released" openspf testsuite to the tests. We previously only tested against "trunk" testsuite and openspf advised to check against the latest release (2008.08). The testsuite check the released suite synchronously and the trunk asynchronously.
Updated pom.xml for the new dnsjnio (JSPF-73)
DNSJava already parsed quoted TXT records correctly, so I moved the "unquote" to the resolver instead of the SPFRetriever that now expect a single, unquoted, string (JSPF-72)
Just cleanup...
Let's rat know we added a 3rd party licensed test file.

Added ability to load all of the zones defined in a yml file. The test files often do define overlapping zones, so this allow testing a full file without reloading the fake server.
